Title: In Which We Serve
Cast: Noël Coward, Derek Elphinstone, Michael Wilding, Robert Sansom, Philip Friend, Chimmo Branson, Ballard Berkeley, Hubert Gregg, James Donald, Michael Whittaker, Kenneth Carten, John Varley, Bernard Miles, Caven Watson, John Mills
Plot: This "story of a ship," the British destroyer HMS Torrin, is told in flash backs by survivors as they cling to a life raft. This is the story of a British Naval ship, HMS Torrin, from its construction to its sinking in the Mediterranean during action in World War II. The ship's first and only commanding officer is the experienced Captain E.V. Kinross who trains his men not only to be loyal to him but to the country and most importantly, to themselves. They face challenges at sea and also at home. They lose some of their shipmates in action and some of their loved ones in the devastation that is the blitz. Throughout it all, the men of the Torrin serve valiantly and heroically. Written by garykmcd
Keywords: officer, captain, destroyer, directorial debut, written and directed by cast member
Awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 5 wins & 1 nomination.
Location: D&P Studios, Denham Studios, Denham, Buckinghamshire, England, UK
Actors: Noël Coward, John Mills, Derek Elphinstone
Director: Noël Coward (as Noel Coward), David Lean
